title: Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
description: This deliciously moist apple cake is topped with homemade cream cheese frosting for a crowd-pleasing potluck dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting 4.8 (84) 76 Reviews 13 Photos This apple cake is bursting with pieces of tender and sweet apple and chopped walnuts. Everyone loves it topped with my cream cheese frosting. Submitted by Michele Starkel Updated on June 26, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 13 13 13 13 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 24 Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 2 large eggs 1 cup vegetable oil 2 cups white sugar 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 4 cups apples - peeled, cored and diced ½ cup chopped walnuts 2 (3 ounce) packages cream cheese 3 tablespoons butter, softened 1 ½ cups confectioners' sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a medium bowl; set aside. Combine eggs, oil, and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until lighter in color. Add flour mixture and beat well. Add vanilla and stir in chopped apples and walnuts. Pour cake batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, about 45 to 50 minutes. Allow cake to cool. To make the frosting: Combine cream cheese, softened butter, confectioners sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in a medium bowl; beat until smooth. Spread on cooled cake. I Made It Print 112 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting 01 of 13 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 13 Photo by  Cococrispy 10/27/2024 Crowd-pleaser Great flavors This recipe is perfect- made it as is. Company raved about it. Cream cheese frosting can overwhelm a lot of things. I really liked the amount of frosting that this made, it frosted the cake within about an inch of the edge. Made it with Honeycrisp apples-delicious!I did not cut back the sugar as some had recommended, and I think it really helped the cake have a crisp to the edges and bottom that made it extra yummy! 03 of 13 Photo by  darlene 01/27/2022 This cake is a keeper. I have added raisins to this recipe. Aside from that I have followed the recipe to the letter. It is delicious. I have made it with and without the cream cheese frosting. 04 of 13 Photo by  Sylvia 02/12/2020 05 of 13 Photo by  Susan 09/26/2019 I suggest using bunt pan for cake. Cake mixture is more on the doughy side. I did not add nuts to the batter. Scope dough into pan, then do layer of apple slices. Cover with rest of batter. After icing cake I sprinkled walnuts on top. 06 of 13 Photo by  Lorie 10/01/2018 07 of 13 Photo by  Pauer5 11/10/2017 Very good made it twice in three days , crowd pleaser. Sprinkled with cinnamon sugar mixture before baking. It doesn't need the heavy frosting. Would definatlymake again. 08 of 13 Photo by  Dan Thomas 09/13/2015 Wow! This was good. I added one extra egg as recommended. I also sub'd in a 1/2 cup of Brown sugar for 1/2 cup of white. We had just picked fresh apples. My son and I diced up the 4 cups instead of using slices. This helped it pour. I then used two 9inch cake pans and filled them half way. I let them cool for 20 minutes in the pans and then loosened them a little with a spatula. Let them cool for 20 more minutes, sliced in half horizontally and made a 4 layer cake. I made about 5 times the icing to cover it all and fill the layers. Holy cow. Take me to heaven! 09 of 13 Photo by  bellasjules 09/28/2014 Pretty awesome! Definitely one to make the day before to enhance the flavor! Don't expect a fluffy cake, this one is dense and moist! 10 of 13 Photo by  Nancey Malone Cassalia 05/17/2009 this cake recipe is a keeper and this is not the first time i've made it!! i actually screwed up this time and i was making it for my honeys birthday! I forgot to add the nuts, which i was using pecans because i was out of walnuts a rareity in itself, so i just chopped the pecans and put then on top which wasn't nearly as good as baked in and still the cake was gr8!! lol!! one of those "murphy's law" days!! all in all this cake is moist and fruity and delicious! a real treat!! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Bavarian-Style Apple Torte 15 Ratings German Apple Pudding Cake 38 Ratings Easy German Apple Streusel Pie 19 Ratings Apfelkuchen 6 Ratings German Apple Sheet Cake 1 Rating Easy German Apple Sheet Cake 6 Ratings Moist German Sheet Pan Apple Cake Zwetschekuchen (German Plum Tart) 10 Ratings German Apple Cake 1,555 Ratings Yabluchnyk (Ukrainian Apple Cake) 81 Ratings Dutch Apple Pie with Oatmeal Streusel 680 Ratings Apple Cake 284 Ratings Cocoa Apple Cake 80 Ratings Apple Cake VII 93 Ratings Nana's Cranberry Kuchen 10 Ratings Spiced Apple Coffee Cake 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Michele Starkel
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a medium bowl; set aside.;Combine eggs, oil, and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until lighter in color. Add flour mixture and beat well. Add vanilla and stir in chopped apples and walnuts. Pour cake batter into prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, about 45 to 50 minutes. Allow cake to cool.;To make the frosting: Combine cream cheese, softened butter, confectioners sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in a medium bowl; beat until smooth. Spread on cooled cake.
